result:
I now have all the data. Note: I was unable to use the domshell MCP tools because the MCP server hasn't been built (no `dist/` directory), so I fetched the page directly via curl. Here are the results:

## First Paragraph

Machine learning (ML) is a field of study in artificial intelligence concerned with the development and study of statistical algorithms that can learn from data and generalize to unseen data, and thus perform tasks without explicit instructions. Within a subdiscipline in machine learning, advances in the field of deep learning have allowed neural networks, a class of statistical algorithms, to surpass many previous machine learning approaches in performance.

## See Also

1. Automated machine learning
2. Big data
3. Deep learning
4. Differentiable programming
5. List of datasets for machine-learning research
6. List of machine learning algorithms
7. M-theory (learning framework)
8. Machine unlearning
9. Outline of machine learning
10. Solomonoff's theory of inductive inference

questions.question: The domshell MCP tools aren't available in my current session (server not built, no Chrome connection). How would you like to proceed?

options.label: Use WebFetch fallback
options.description: I'll use my built-in WebFetch tool to navigate to the Wikipedia Machine Learning article and extract the first paragraph and See Also section

options.label: Build MCP server first
options.description: I'll compile the MCP server TypeScript, then you can restart the session with the domshell tools connected to Chrome

options.label: Both - build & fallback
options.description: Build the MCP server for future use, and use WebFetch now to get results immediately
